name: Kenneth Deal
text: Awesome place!!! Great Atmosphere!! Everyone you meet treats you like family weather they work at Flipside or just there to hangout and ride.

name: Daniel Garaguso
text: Super laid back place to come hangout and wakeboard or wake skate. There is plenty shade to hangout in by the water as well.

name: Beth Sorrells
text: Awesome fun. Wear shoes at all times, stickers in the grass. Never saw it before the tornado,  but we has a blast!

name: Laura Taylor
text: Great place for social distancing fun. Not crowded during the week, reasonable rental rates for kayaks and paddleboards. Kids LOVED the Aqua Park. Highly recommend it.

name: Scottie Elkins
text: Great family friendly fun! Highly recommended!

name: jacqueline jackson
text: Awesome place with a lake in a quarry that is huge!!! open for all kinds of water activities. So far also open everyday from 10am-6pm. Went tandem canoeing with a friend, while another friend chose the paddleboard  since all of the kayaks were taken.  It's $20 per vessel for TANDEM CANOEING per hour. Can't remeber the price for paddleboards and kayaks for an hour. People at the desk were friendly and nice. Was easy to get to the canoes etc and get in the water. The hour was a good time limit for us and we travelled up and down the lake. Will be going back!!

name: Scott Schulhofer
text: Great spot to chill at

name: Brian Black
text: This is an awesome place to improve on Wake Board Cable riding! Is Family Owned, and they are also helping safely advance riders with support and advice! The Regulars are the same way! I just started riding cable recently, and everyone out there has helped me see improvement. Very positive atmosphere, very awesome people! They also have a tube and knee board for the cable and stand up paddle boards also! Go Shred Today!

name: Elyce Thompson
text: Spider-Man’s cool

name: Bill Heslop
text: First class operation

name: John A
text: I’ve gone here 2 times and I never wanted to stop

name: Frank Butera
text: Kids had a great time

name: Taisha Davis
text: This is an activity inside of oak mountain state park. You have to pay to play but it's fun with friends and family. It's paid by the hour. Prices vary.

name: Christine Golab
text: Such a great place and so much fun!

name: R Heffner
text: All I can say is AMAZING...Had a blast!

name: Michelle Emens
text: Friendly and helpful. Great to be able to rent equipment and enjoy the lake while we are camping at Oak Mountain State Park!

name: jennessa rich
text: worth every penny and drive. can’t wait for next summer!!!

name: Ann Turner
text: For starters, you pay "per hour," which to them means their family members can ride the entire hour leaving your eight year old patiently waiting and then leaving her very little time to ride. We were told everybody rotated every 7 minutes. This did not happen. We were told somebody would instruct her. This did not happen. My husband (who is not a wake boarder) had to swim out and assist her while their staff sat around like a bump on a log. Overpriced for what you get! Lots of sitting around while their family plays. I expressed my thoughts on their Facebook page and was told I would be refunded if I took my review down. I declined, as I don't appreciate being bribed. Now, of course, they've removed my review. If you are going to run a business I suggest you learn to take a little criticism. I should have been offered a refund on the spot. But to tell make me that offer was just very poor taste.

name: Spencer Stantis
text: A really cool wake-boarding park in Oak Mountain state park. It's alot of fun and they did a really did a good job with the course.

name: Todd Shaw
text: Love it! Best to ride during business/school hours.  Less waiting in line but always worth the wait.

name: Dessie Jackson
text: I had the most amazing time with my family and friend

name: Tildon Williamson
text: Awesome place for the whole family!

name: Eddie Reyes
text: Worst wakepark I've ever been to. Way too long of a wait for you to wakeboard for like 10 minutes in a 2 hour session that cost $35. Will never be coming back here again. I suggest going to terminus instead of this ripoff of a wakepark

resp.text: Eddie, it's unfortunate that we were not able to meet your expectations. I'm sure that you noticed, since you have been to our park multiple times, that we are not set up the same as Terminus. They are a much larger park with two full size systems that are capable of pulling 6-12 riders at a time, where we are a small operation with 2 two-tower systems that can only pull one rider at a time on each cable. With our current setup, weekends tend to be are busiest time, but I feel certain that if you were to visit our park early during the week when we are open 7 days a week, you will be able to achieve more ride time for the same amount of money since there wouldn't be as many people signed up. We hope that your experience doesn't prevent you from returning to our facility.

name: Andrey Reshetnyak
text: Great wakeboarding experience

name: FightFanMan 87
text: Super fun

name: Dennis Gibbs
text: It was fun

name: Justin Gipson
text: Best place on earth

name: Francisco Cuan
text: It was really nice

name: Scott Joe Bernstein
text: Greatest place on earth

name: Claudeo Davis
text: This is the parks rental, bait & lure headquarters

name: Bill Al Hamdeh
text: Friendly staff

name: YUNJAE WON
text: Watersports , swimming and picnics
